1.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity
to place (in a very wide application)
an army; also (by analogy,) an intrenchment

an opening, i.e. door or gate
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.

to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

to sink or depress (reflexive or causative)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry

a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda

properly, to roll flat, i.e. prepare (a road); also to revolve, i.e. weigh (mentally)
